Amendments to the Energy Policy Act of 2005 include changes to national grant, rebate, and loan programs for eligible entities in certain US territories. The Diesel Emissions Reduction Act of 2010 amends subsections (b) and (c) by redesignating paragraphs, adjusting percentages, and specifying a verification application process for expedited approval. The Administrator will develop a simplified application process for expedited fund provision, considering small fleet owners' circumstances and may require competitive bidding results. Eligible entities must submit an application containing required information to receive a grant under this section. In subsection (d), amendments are made to include rebates and contracts in the eligibility criteria for grants and loans. Additionally, adjustments are made to comply with Federal laws, excluding mandates in State implementation plans approved under the Clean Air Act. A new section on Contract Programs is added at the end. The Administrator may enter into contracts with eligible contractors for programs providing rebates or loans for diesel vehicles or equipment upgrades. Eligible contractors can be for-profit or nonprofit entities with the capacity to sell or finance diesel vehicles or arrange upgrades with verified engines or technologies. The Administrator can contract with eligible contractors for programs offering rebates or loans for diesel vehicle upgrades. The Environmental Protection Agency must publicly disclose details of grants, rebates, or loans awarded within 60 days. State grant, rebate, and loan programs under the Energy Policy Act of 2005 are also amended. The Administrator can contract with eligible contractors for programs offering rebates or loans for diesel vehicle upgrades. State grant, rebate, and loan programs under the Energy Policy Act of 2005 are amended to allocate funds to each qualifying State. The Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands receives an allocation equal to 1/53 of funds for distribution to States. If a State does not qualify, funds are reallocated to remaining qualified States.
